Author: Ryan Parrish
summary: Highly skilled Full Stack Developer and Designer with [Number] years of experience delivering impactful web solutions for diverse clients, including Adobe, Nike, and Backcountry.com. Proven ability to lead development teams, architect complex e-commerce platforms, and create engaging user experiences. Expertise in [Mention 2-3 key technologies, e.g., WordPress CMS, Angular.js, REST APIs].

experience.title: Senior Developer
details: Led a focused development team at Adobe to create Milo, a product built on the AEM/EDS platform, architecting foundational components for adobe.com and subsidiary sites.
Collaborated closely with design teams and stakeholders to ensure seamless integration and optimal user experience.
Delivered impactful web solutions for clients including Chobani and Credit Acceptance.

experience.title: Web Developer
details: Engineered and maintained LifeVantage.com, a high-volume e-commerce platform built on a complex WordPress CMS, supporting intricate downline workflows and extensive multi-language capabilities.
Spearheaded the LifeVantage customer referral program, driving substantial growth in customer acquisition.

experience.title: Interactive Developer
details: Integrated directly with the Nike team to develop and maintain zero.nike.com, a critical internal portal for Nike employees, associates, and athletes.
Architected a custom WordPress backend and headless Angular.js frontend, implementing complex features such as localization, third-party integrations, and custom REST APIs.
Contributed to a diverse portfolio of client projects, including Riot Games and Clearlink.

experience.title: Front End Developer
details: Delivered front-end development for a spectrum of clients, including RMI (Resource Management), Courtview Justice Solutions, and Backcountry.com.
Demonstrated adaptability and ability to handle projects of varying complexity and scale.

education.institution: North West College of Art & Design, Poulsbo, WA
details: Bachelor of Fine Arts with a double major in Fine Art/Multimedia.
Comprehensive study of traditional painting, graphic design, animation, video production, and business communications.
